results.title: The Golden land: 1840s-1900
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Destination Australia: the migrant experience since 1788”.
This film examines the period of Australian history, 1840-1900, that included the Gold-rush years and the farming boom.

results.title: The Golden gate
results.brief_description: Members of the United Nations celebrate the tenth anniversary of the signing of the United Nations Charter in San Francisco in 1945. An interesting historical perspective in the Cold War era containing speeches from Eisenhower, McMillan, and Molotov.

results.title: The Gold rush. - Edited version
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin, Dennis R. Atkinson and Spectra Films
results.brief_description: An abridged version of Charlie Chaplin’s 1925 silent film classic, with commentary and a music track added. Deals with the hardships of life on the Alaskan frontier. Suitable for film studies students.

results.title: The Gold ghost
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton, Charles Lamont, E Allen and Educational Films Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Dumped by his girlfriend, Buster drives west and winds up in a ghost town called Vulture City, where he appoints himself sheriff. Also stars Dorothy Dix, William Worthington and Lloyd Ingraham. Written by Ewart Adamson and Nicholas T. Barrows.

results.title: The Gold diggers
results.brief_description: A humorous dramatisation of the ballad about two diggers in search of gold. They are frustrated by bad weather, the lure of the ‘grog’, hard rock, costly water and finally…no gold! The words were written on the Victorian goldfields in the 1850s.

results.title: The Godless state
results.creator_credit: Michael Houlday, Michael Murphy and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Christians”.
Traces the development of religious indifference and atheism from the French Revolution to the present. Focuses on the current state of religion in the Soviet Union, Poland, and Italy. However, makes the statement that with the New Testament there is no clear impression for readers about what Christianity stood for. The reader can glean from it any message that he/she wants…therefore Christianity has the ability to adapt.

results.title: The Goddess and the moon man
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Sandra Holmes and Morning Star Productions
results.brief_description: A myth about Pukamani, a mortuary ceremony of the Tiwi people of Melville Island, Northern Australia. Dramatically told through the use of the authentic Pukamani grave posts, sculptures and artefacts, fashioned long ago by Tiwi elders for the ceremony.

results.title: The Goalkeeper - with Ray Clemence
results.creator_credit: Terry Ryan, Ray Marshall and Opix Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Focus on Soccer”.
England’s keeper Ray Clemence demonstrates the technique involved in safe goalkeeping including handling, clearances, and organising defences of set pieces. Also provides insight into the responsibilities of a goalkeeper in the modern game.

results.title: The Glow worm
results.brief_description: A film made to show the characteristics and habits of glow-worms; shows male and female glow-worms for identification and comparisons; laying of eggs by the female; hatching of the young in the spring; details of thorax, head and other parts of glow-worm; the hunt for food; changes of skin; further changes of skin in Summer when adult males and females emerge; changed structure of the glow-worm; mating and continuance of the life cycle.
